pullRequest.title: implemented the listing of resource versions

commit.message: implemented the listing of resource versions
added some itests for listing versions

nodes.bodyText:

nodes.bodyText:
It would be good if we were more consistent about using constants... but we can at least start with the present.
Could you use: https://github.com/fcrepo4/fcrepo4/blob/master/fcrepo-kernel-api/src/main/java/org/fcrepo/kernel/api/FedoraTypes.java#L96

A comment here would be helpful. Something like:
A `version` passed into this method indicates that the resource is actually a Memento
For clarity, should this be named originalResource?
For my own understanding, what is the value in using var here and below instead of the actual return type?

Should we also consider updating other instances of resource.get(), such as:

https://github.com/fcrepo4/fcrepo4/blob/master/fcrepo-http-commons/src/main/java/org/fcrepo/http/commons/api/rdf/HttpResourceConverter.java#L101
https://github.com/fcrepo4/fcrepo4/blob/master/fcrepo-http-api/src/main/java/org/fcrepo/http/api/ContentExposingResource.java#L915-L918
Is this method getting called anywhere?
If we think there may be more conditional logic on a Resource being a Memento or not, we could potentially consider have a Memento sub-interface of Resource... like TimeMap.
The @throws comment does not match the exceptions that are actually thrown.

nodes.bodyText: Would it make sense to have an OCFLVersionImpl constructor that takes the values being set below? Or is the idea that these values are expected to change through the course of the OCFLVersion's lifecycle?
Please add a comment indicating that there is an expectation at this point that the rootObjectId does not include a trailing slash.
Is hamcrest.contains sufficient here? Does it imply "contains and only contains"?
